main event: Various UFO sightings were reported from different locations between 20 - 31 March 1953, with evaluations ranging from ground radar to visual and radar observations.
interesting points: An F-94 pilot observed a long contrail-like object at 25,000 ft. and engaged his gun camera film while chasing it, prompting Project Blue Book to analyze the film.
In one report, an unidentified object in Red Lion, Ohio turned out to be a discarded WW II bazooka shell, causing no actual threat.
A statistical survey of 1950 reports indicated no significant trends on the report of unidentified aerial objects as far as maneuvers, color, speed, time of sighting, locality, etc.
The document was declassified in December 1999, suggesting a level of transparency in the handling of UFO reports.

The sightings included various locations such as Korea, Alaska, New York, Wyoming, Texas, Michigan, England, Alaska, Florida, Morocco, Newfoundland, New Mexico, Illinois, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, Japan, Arizona, and Montana.
result: mixed evaluations including unidentified, balloon, possible satellite bullet, and meteor
location: various - including Korea, Alaska, New York, Wyoming, Texas, Michigan, England, Florida, Morocco, Newfoundland, New Mexico, Illinois, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, Japan, Arizona, and Montana
witnesses: military personnel, civilian employee, and government observers
